original: Högström, Karl-Albert, telegraf-kommissarie, Norrköping, f. 2/2/90 i Nederluleå, Norrb. 1., av förrådsförv. J. P. Högström o. Emma Andersson. G. 34 m. Signe Åkerberg. — Mog:ex. i Luleå 08, telegrafassist :kurs 10, ra-diokommiss :kurs 16, ’språkstud. i Frankr. 29, 30 o. 31. E. o. telegrafassist. 10, telegrafassistent 13, kontrollör 21, förste dito 33, överkontrollör 39, trafikinsp. 41, telegrafkommiss. av kl. 1 A sed. 47.
translated: Högström, Karl-Albert, Telegraph Officer, Norrköping, b. February 2, 1890, in Nederluleå, Norrbotten County, son of warehouse manager J.P. Högström and Emma Andersson. Married 1934 to Signe Åkerberg. Completed military service in Luleå in 1908, telegraph assistant training in 1910, radio officer training in 1916, and language studies in France in 1929, 1930, and 1931. Employed as telegraph assistant in 1910, telegraph operator in 1913, control operator in 1921, first control operator in 1933, chief control operator in 1939, traffic inspector in 1941, and promoted to Telegraph Officer of Class 1 A in 1947.

education.description: Completed military service in Luleå in 1908
Completed language studies in France in 1929, 1930 and 1931
